message: Watched the new one last night, was unimpressed.
I'm usually a huge fan of their show.
i used to watch it all the time when i was actually into cars
however that clip that @alex posted awhile ago was really funny
Their "specials" are just so awesome usually
I love to watch it for the cinematography. Not a fan of the "US" version
I didn't realize the one they air here is a US version. I was never a huge fan of the UK one when I lived there so haven't tried watching it here yet.
I also found the change of VO guy from UK to USA mythbusters particularly baffling!
Great show!
But Top Gear UK is amazing IMO
Top Gear without Jeremy, Richard, and James isn't Top Gear
@briand Definitely agreed, US version sucks
@spencer two clarifying points. The one aired on BBC America except for season 16 were edited (dumbed) down from the UK Versions.
Top gear uk is far better than US
Yes it is
@ericflo anyone seen Aussie version?
Which was hilarious
Poor Mexicans, who's next?
@aidz I saw when the UK version went up agains the Aussie version
As always. Same story happened with Germans :)
anyone saw last weeks UK show, that bank robbery challenge was EPIC!!!!
I'd really like to see the recent episode where the boys dress up in burkas and drive through Jordan or Syria
Is that the one on BBC America tomorrow night at 10:20pm?
@maplestar Usually BBC America is at least a season behind, unless that has changed
@MDixon. That's the "Three wise men" episode. Hilarious doesn't begin to describe that episode.
did anyone see last nights with the 3 BMW's
On the one hand, I love the Top Gear specials... but on the other hand, the (UK) presenters are basically jerks
@italiano40 Yes, just finished.
Stewart Lee's take on Top Gear is pretty awesome: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w0i0RXMvzMs
I don't understand the vitriol towards the presenters.
@mafi yea i love old BMW i am a sucker for them LOL
@spencer The Top Gear aired on History channel is the "US Version" of the Top Gear "franchise"
